p: Seeds of Nigella contain two types of oils; 37.5% non-volatile oil, while 1.5% volatile oil. In addition to these organic acids, mineral elements (Mg, Ca, Cu,Mn, K) terpene, many amino acids, albumen, sugar, organic acids, enzyme lipase, many alcohol-soluble organic acids, fats and water-soluble vitamins. Nigellimine is also reported in research. Other important active components of seed of Nigella include thymol, thymohydroquinone, and dithymoquinone ( Morikawa et al., 2004, Ghaznavi, 1996, Nasir et al., 2014).
